sentences.en: By 1944, Fletcher had command of a B-17 bomber and a ten-man crew.
sentences.cn: 到1944年，弗莱彻已负责指挥一架B-17轰炸机和十名机组人员。

sentences.en: Captain Picard commanded the crew to report to the main deck.
sentences.cn: 皮卡德船长命令全体船员到主甲板上报到。

sentences.en: Dividing his command, Morgan assailed both strongholds at the same time.
sentences.cn: 摩根派遣部队同时袭击了两个据点。

sentences.en: During the second world war he served with RAF Coastal Command.
sentences.cn: 二战期间他在英国皇家空军海防总队服役。

sentences.en: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.cn: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.en: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.cn: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.en: He didn't just command. He personally fought in several heavy battles.
sentences.cn: 他不仅仅发号施令，还身先士卒参加了几次激战。

sentences.en: He was posted to Hong Kong as second-in-command of C Squadron.
sentences.cn: 他被派遣到香港任C中队的副队长。

sentences.en: He’s studied in the US and has a good command of English.
sentences.cn: 他在美国留过学，精通英语。

sentences.en: His command of English was excellent.
sentences.cn: 他精通英语。

sentences.en: I left a sergeant in command and rode forward to reconnoitre.
sentences.cn: 我留下一名中士指挥，自己策马前去侦察敌情。

sentences.en: I shall defend myself with all the eloquence at my command.
sentences.cn: 我将用我所有的口才来为自己辩护。

sentences.en: In 1942 he took command of 108 Squadron.
sentences.cn: 1942年,他是108飞行中队的指挥官.

sentences.en: Mr Baker would take command of the campaign.
sentences.cn: 贝克先生会负责这次运动。

sentences.en: Reimar had a fair command of English.
sentences.cn: 赖马尔的英语说得还不错。

sentences.en: Shoot when I give the command .
sentences.cn: 我一下命令就开枪。

sentences.en: The man appeared to be in complete command of himself.
sentences.cn: 那个男人看上去神态自如。

sentences.en: The most desirable properties necessarily command astonishingly high prices.
sentences.cn: 最值得拥有的财产必然要价不菲。

sentences.en: The naval high command's response to these developments is rather curious.
sentences.cn: 海军最高指挥部对这些进展的回应十分反常。

sentences.en: The party that commands a majority of seats in Parliament forms the government.
sentences.cn: 在议会拥有多数席位的党派可以组建政府。

sentences.en: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.cn: 警方掌握的权力和资金

sentences.en: The President was replaced by his second-in-command.
sentences.cn: 总统一职由其副手接替。

sentences.en: They command the respect and obedience of the armed forces.
sentences.cn: 他们要求武装部队尊重上级，服从指挥。

sentences.en: Whoever was waiting for them there had command of the situation.
sentences.cn: 在那边等候他们的人控制了局势。

words.tran_cn: 指挥的；居高临下的；威风凛凛的
司令官，指挥官；军事学校的校长

phrases.tran_cn: 由某人支配；听从某人的指示
指令性经济；中央管制经济

trans.tran_en: the control of a group of people or a situation

trans.tran_cn: 命令， 指挥； 统帅， 支配； 控制； 掌握， 精通； 俯视； 赢得
trans.tran_en: the control of a group of people or a situation

trans.tran_cn: 命令， 指挥； 控制
trans.tran_en: the control of a group of people or a situation

trans.tran_cn: 命令，赢得，控制，指挥，俯瞰
trans.tran_en: to tell someone officially to do something, especially if you are a military leader, a king etc

trans.tran_cn: 命令， 指挥， 控制
trans.tran_en: to tell someone officially to do something, especially if you are a military leader, a king etc
